result.execSummary:
The defendant Ubaldo NMI Garcia Perez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to report to the Probation and Parole Office tomorrow (10/19/2022) by 9:00 am

miscConds.notes:
Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.  Defendant is to pay costs, fines, surcharges or fees directly to and will be collected by the Clark County Clerk of Court.
Defendant granted payment plan of $25.00 per month to begin 11/1/2022, to include case 22CF32, 05CM504 and 22CF61.  Bond of $500.00 applied.
The defendant is to submit to an Alcohol and Other Drug Assessment (AODA) and follow the recommendations, releasing the findings to the agent.
Defendant to maintain at least 25 hours of employment a week or as directed by his agent.

The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as
directed by the agent. The defendant shall submit to random
urine/PBT testing as required by the agent or any law
enforcement officer.

Defendant is not to drive any motorized vehicle: (a) unless defendant is in possession of a valid Wisconsin operator's license for the type of motor vehicle being driven; (b) defendant and such motor vehicle are insured as required by law; and (c) defendant is in possession of valid proof of insurance while operating the motor vehicle. Defendant  shall not be in the presence or possession of drugs or drug paraphernalia, or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a licensed Wisconsin medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ubaldo NMI Garcia Perez

records.addlTxt: 3:15 PM Defendant Ubaldo NMI Garcia Perez in court.  Attorney Bryant S Plank in court for Ubaldo NMI Garcia Perez.  Prosecuting attorney Melissa S. Inlow in court for the State of Wisconsin. Susan Rascon, previously sworn as interpreter.   Preliminary hearing waived.    The Court finds that the defendant has waived their right to a preliminary hearing, intelligently, knowingly and of their own free will and accepts the waiver, finds probable cause and binds the case over for further proceedings.  The defendant enters a plea of No Contest  The Court finds that the defendant has entered their plea, knowingly, intelligently and of their own free will and finds the defendant Guilty.

Defendant is not to drive any motorized vehicle: (a) unless defendant is in possession of a valid Wisconsin operator's license for the type of motor vehicle being driven; (b) defendant and such motor vehicle are insured as required by law; and (c) defendant is in possession of valid proof of insurance while operating the motor vehicle.    Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  Defendant shall not be in the presence or possession of drugs or drug paraphernalia, or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a licensed Wisconsin medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.  Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.  
THE $500 CASH BOND COVERS THIS CASE AND CASE 05CM504 - PAY $500 ONCE AND SIGN TWO BONDS.

Attorney Melissa S. Inlow appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Ubaldo NMI Garcia Perez appeared, pro se by video from Clark County Jail.    Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.  Defendant advised of right to an attorney.  Susan Rascon sworn as interpreter.  Initial appearance scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
